New Records: Deni Avdija logged a career-low 10 turnovers.
Key Match Events: Portland Trail Blazers forward Deni Avdija took responsibility for his team's 125-103 blowout defeat to the Philadelphia 76ers.
Joel Embiid chipped in a game-high 37 points on 12-of-21 shooting from the field and 12-of-13 shooting from the charity stripe, nine rebounds, and three assists.
Portland got within eight points in the third frame, but a 19-8 Sixers run essentially wrapped up the game.
Portland fell behind by as many as 27 points in the contest's fourth frame.
Post-Match Reflections: Deni Avdija said, 'I’m taking responsibility. I’ve never had that amount. The ball was not in my hands very good today.'
Portland head coach Chauncey Billups remarked, 'It’s one of those games that when you have all those things working against you at one time, you usually have a scary night.'

Billups also commented on Joel Embiid's performance, 'The big fella was like we saw him in his MVP year. Give them [the 76ers] credit ... They’re physical. Defensively they try to take a lot of things away from you.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: All five of Portland's starters scored in double figures, but no one off the bench got cooking.
The Trail Blazers struggled to connect from long range, going just 8-of-36 from distance (22.2 percent).
The victory improves the 76ers to 13-17 on the season, while the loss plummets Portland to 11-21, the sixth-worst record in the league.
